Discrete Laplace Operator

Concepts

Curvature

Reference: https://mathworld.wolfram.com/Curvature.html

Measure local bending of the surface

rdϕ=dsϕ=∫0ts′(t)κ(t)dtr=1∣κ∣r d \phi = d s \\ \phi = \int_0^t s'(t) \kappa(t) dt \\ r = \frac{1}{|\kappa|}rdϕ=dsϕ=∫0t​s′(t)κ(t)dtr=∣κ∣1​

where κ\kappaκ is curvature, sss is arc length (length along a curve), ϕ\phiϕ is tangential angle, rrr is radius of curvature

For 2d curve y=f(x)y = f(x)y=f(x), its curvature is defined by

κ=∂2f∂x2(1+(∂f∂x)2)32\kappa = \frac{\frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x^2}}{(1 + (\frac{\partial f}{\partial x})^2)^{\frac{3}{2}}}κ=(1+(∂x∂f​)2)23​∂x2∂2f​​

Obtuse triangle

Triangle with one angle bigger than π/2\pi/2π/2, so its circumcenter point is outside triangle

Mass matrix

Discretization of inner-product (kinda like kernel?)

Discrete differential geometry operators

Reference: http://multires.caltech.edu/pubs/diffGeoOps.pdf

Surface SSS embedded in R3\mathbb{R}^3R3 can be locally approximated by tangent plane, orthogonal to normal vector nnn.

Normal curvature

For unit direction eθ\bm{e_{\theta}}eθ​ in the tangent plane, starting from the point where the tangent plane is evaluated, the normal curvature κN(θ)\kappa_N(\theta)κN​(θ) is defined as the curvature of curve that wraps eθ\bm{e_{\theta}}eθ​ onto SSS. (like how matrix exponetiation wraps vector on tangent plane to manifold)

Principle curvatures

Two extremum Normal curvature κ1\kappa_1κ1​ and κ2\kappa_2κ2​ (2 cause SSS is 2 dimensional manifold) with associated orthogonal direction e1\bm{e_1}e1​ and e2\bm{e_2}e2​.

Mean curvature

average of Normal curvature

κH=12π∫02πκN(θ)dθ\kappa_H = \frac{1}{2\pi}\int_{0}^{2\pi} \kappa^N(\theta)d\thetaκH​=2π1​∫02π​κN(θ)dθ

It can also be defined with Principle curvatures as

κH=(κ1+κ2)/2\kappa_H = (\kappa_1 + \kappa_2)/2κH​=(κ1​+κ2​)/2

Gaussian curvature

product of the two Principle curvatures

κG=κ1κ2\kappa_G = \kappa_1 \kappa_2κG​=κ1​κ2​

Relation between surface area minimization and mean curvature flow

2κHn=lim⁡diameter(A)→0∇AA2\kappa_H\bm{n} = \lim_{diameter(A) \to 0} \frac{\nabla A}{A}2κH​n=diameter(A)→0lim​A∇A​

Laplace-Beltrami

Maps point on surface to vector

For p∈S\bm{p} \in Sp∈S

K(p)=2κH(p)n(p)\bm{K}(\bm{p}) = 2 \kappa_H(\bm{p})\bm{n}(\bm{p})K(p)=2κH​(p)n(p)

Define properies of surface at each vertex as spatial average of 1-ring neighbourhood of this vertex

1-ring neighbourhood boundary

For a given vertex, find all barycenter/circumcenter for all incident triangles, piecewisely connect centers and incident edge midpoints.

Note that 1-ring neighbourhood for each vertex won't overlaps

Discrete Mean curvature Normal

K(xi)=12AMixed∑j∈N1(i)(cot⁡αij+cot⁡βij)(xi−xj)\bm{K}(\bm{x}_i) = \frac{1}{2 A_{Mixed}} \sum_{j \in N_1(i)}(\cot \alpha_{ij} + \cot \beta_{ij})(\bm{x}_i - \bm{x}_j)K(xi​)=2AMixed​1​j∈N1​(i)∑​(cotαij​+cotβij​)(xi​−xj​)

where αij\alpha_{ij}αij​ and βij\beta_{ij}βij​ are angles opposite to shared edge (xi,xj)(\bm{x}_i, \bm{x}_j)(xi​,xj​), N1(i)N_1(i)N1​(i) is the set of 1-ring neighbour vertex, AMixedA_{Mixed}AMixed​ is

AMixed={Avoronoinon-obtuse triangle14Anon-obtuse angle of obtuse triangle12Aobtuse angle of obtuse triangle\begin{equation} A_{Mixed} = \begin{cases} A_{voronoi} & \text{non-obtuse triangle}\\ \frac{1}{4} A & \text{non-obtuse angle of obtuse triangle}\\ \frac{1}{2} A & \text{obtuse angle of obtuse triangle} \end{cases} \end{equation}AMixed​=⎩⎨⎧​Avoronoi​41​A21​A​non-obtuse trianglenon-obtuse angle of obtuse triangleobtuse angle of obtuse triangle​​​

that can be stored in diagonal Mass matrix

Discrete Gaussian curvature

κG(xi)=(2π−∑j=i#fθj)/AMixed\kappa_G(\bm{x}_i) = (2\pi - \sum_{j=i}^{\#f} \theta_j)/A_{Mixed}κG​(xi​)=(2π−j=i∑#f​θj​)/AMixed​

where θj\theta_jθj​ the angle at the jjj-th face at vertex xi\bm{x}_ixi​ #f\#f#f is number of faces around this vertex

Discrete Principle curvatures

Use equation defined in Mean curvature and Gaussian curvature

κ1(xi)=κH(xi)+Δ(xi)κ2(xi)=κH(xi)−Δ(xi)\kappa_1(\bm{x}_i) = \kappa_H(\bm{x}_i) + \sqrt{\Delta(\bm{x}_i)} \\ \kappa_2(\bm{x}_i) = \kappa_H(\bm{x}_i) - \sqrt{\Delta(\bm{x}_i)}κ1​(xi​)=κH​(xi​)+Δ(xi​)​κ2​(xi​)=κH​(xi​)−Δ(xi​)​

with Δ(xi)=κH2(xi)−κG(xi)\Delta(\bm{x}_i) = \kappa_H^2(\bm{x}_i) - \kappa_G(\bm{x}_i)Δ(xi​)=κH2​(xi​)−κG​(xi​) and κH(xi)=12∥K(xi)∥\kappa_H(\bm{x}_i) = \frac{1}{2}\|\bm{K}(\bm{x}_i)\|κH​(xi​)=21​∥K(xi​)∥. Δ(xi)\Delta(\bm{x}_i)Δ(xi​) must be positive for numerical reason

Pre-Vertex Principle curvatures

Discrete Mean curvature Normal can be written in quadratic form

K(xi)=∑j∈N1(i)wijκi,jN\bm{K}(\bm{x}_i) = \sum_{j\in N_1(i)} w_{ij} \kappa_{i,j}^NK(xi​)=j∈N1​(i)∑​wij​κi,jN​

where wij=1AMixed(18(cot⁡αj+cot⁡βj)∥xi−xj∥2)w_{ij} = \frac{1}{A_{Mixed}} (\frac{1}{8}(\cot \alpha_j + \cot \beta_j)\|\bm{x}_i - \bm{x}_j\|^2)wij​=AMixed​1​(81​(cotαj​+cotβj​)∥xi​−xj​∥2), κi,jn=2(xi−xj)⋅n∥xi−xj∥2\kappa_{i,j}^n = 2 \frac{(\bm{x}_i - \bm{x}_j)\cdot \bm{n}}{\|\bm{x}_i - \bm{x}_j\|^2}κi,jn​=2∥xi​−xj​∥2(xi​−xj​)⋅n​, which defines the Normal curvature along edge xixj\bm{x}_i\bm{x}_jxi​xj​

Define a symmetric curvature tensor B=[abbc]B = \begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ b & c \end{bmatrix}B=[ab​bc​] that can be used to compute Normal curvature in any directions of the tangent plane (kinda like the Inner Product)

The unit direction of the projection of edge xixj\bm{x}_i\bm{x}_jxi​xj​ on tangent plane can be computed as

di,jTBdi,j=κi,jN\bm{d}_{i,j}^T B \bm{d}_{i,j} = \kappa_{i,j}^Ndi,jT​Bdi,j​=κi,jN​
di,j=(xj−xi)−((xj−xi)⋅n)n∥(xj−xi)−((xj−xi)⋅n)n∥\bm{d}_{i,j} = \frac{(\bm{x}_j - \bm{x}_i) - ((\bm{x}_j - \bm{x}_i) \cdot \bm{n}) \bm{n}}{\|(\bm{x}_j - \bm{x}_i) - ((\bm{x}_j - \bm{x}_i) \cdot \bm{n}) \bm{n}\|}di,j​=∥(xj​−xi​)−((xj​−xi​)⋅n)n∥(xj​−xi​)−((xj​−xi​)⋅n)n​

a+b=2κHac−b2=κGa + b = 2\kappa_H \\ ac - b^2 = \kappa_Ga+b=2κH​ac−b2=κG​

My personal knowledge cache using [Dendron](https://www.dendron.so)

## History
It was during my first job, at the start-up company called PixelShift.AI, that I acquired most prominent skill as a software engineer-the ability to read source code. It opened up a new way of learning and my knowledge expanded rapidly ever since. Learning new things is thriving but noting them down cogently and organized is hard. I often found myself forget the context few month later, making the notes completely intelligible. Additionally, some notes need frequent update as my previous understanding could be parochial, antiquated or even erroneous.

In desperate attempt to facilitate the noting/updating experience, I came across [Dendron](https://www.dendron.so) and found it surprisingly congenial to my personal need. With it, I have gradually grown the habit of caching, linking back and extending my knowledge base.

## Disclaimer
The notes are collections of information I found along the journey. I use backquote to denote sources, but I am likely to miss some references, so apology in advance. Also, they are my personal understandings, usually added when I first encounter the topic and will be updated only when I come across it again, so some of them could be incomplete or wrong.
